quest.name: The Heart of Nations
journal: If you wish for employment, Cirina has a suggestion.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Mayhap now would be a good time to speak with Gosetsu at greater length, and learn more of our countrymen's plight.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Such kindness and generosity they have shown not only my lord, but us all. Victory in the Naadam will be a fitting repayment!

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: It will be a little while before the meal is ready. If you and Lyse wish to fill the time, perhaps you could assist Dorbei?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: He has many responsibilities, and would welcome your help. Nor would you regret making his acquaintance, for he is liked and respected by all.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: You may find him by the other yurt, taking stock of our supplies.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Leave the cooking to me! I promise I will not disappoint you.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: Ah. One of the newcomers. Welcome. I spoke with Lyse.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: I bade her help the children gather fuel for the cookfires. I trust it will be a good experience for all.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: For you too, perhaps. Seek them in the south, across the bridge.

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: Please use the bridge. One should not sully flowing waters without cause.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! Are you here to help too?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Great! So...I suppose Dorbei told you that the children and I are gathering “fuel” for the fires, did he?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It'll need to be dried before they can burn it, of course. You, um...you do understand what we're here for, right? Only, some people can be a bit squeamish about this sort of stuff.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Then again, you've never minded getting your hands dirty, have you? Anyway, we're trying to get four piles each. Good luck! And keep an eye on the children while you're at it, eh?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The children are around here somewhere. You should talk to them. They're great!

dialogue.name: 01GIRL02505
dialogue.text: Oh, you are Lyse's friend! Are you here to help us too?

dialogue.name: 02BOY02505
dialogue.text: ...How do you do.

dialogue.name: 03BOY02505
dialogue.text: Traveler! I will not lose to you! I shall find three times as much dung as you─at least!

dialogue.name: 04GIRL02505
dialogue.text: I cannot seem to find any dung here. Maybe somewhere else...?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well? Have you found your share yet?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Good work. I hope you took the time to talk to the children while you were at it.

dialogue.name: 03BOY02505
dialogue.text: Lyse! Lyse! Look how much dung we have!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Wow, I'm impressed! I thought we'd gathered a lot, but it looks like we'll have to admit defeat!

dialogue.name: 04GIRL02505
dialogue.text: Dorbei will be happy we found enough...

dialogue.name: 01GIRL02505
dialogue.text: Not just Dorbei! Now we can continue making cheese! Not that I was worried─it was easier when we were living near that forest, but dung works just as well as wood.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I heard the Mol move from place to place─that the gods tell you where to go. That must be hard on you all...

dialogue.name: 03BOY02505
dialogue.text: Hard? I do not understand. Why is it hard?

dialogue.name: 03BOY02505
dialogue.text: It is better for the animals to move─to have more food to eat and land to roam. To stay in one place is harder, no?

dialogue.name: 02BOY02505
dialogue.text: ...From the heavens comes the rain which nourishes the soil. From the soil comes the grass which nourishes the beast. From the beast comes the flesh which nourishes the Xaela. Ours is the soil of one and all.

dialogue.name: 01GIRL02505
dialogue.text: But you Westerners are like the Domans─you live in the same place. In villages. And all the villages in one place are part of a “nation,” yes?

dialogue.name: 01GIRL02505
dialogue.text: Hien talks about nations sometimes. When he was injured, he spoke of Doma in his sleep, but I did not understand his words.

dialogue.name: 04GIRL02505
dialogue.text: Whenever I ask him about Doma, he just smiles and looks to the south...

dialogue.name: 04GIRL02505
dialogue.text: It reminds me of my mother when she waits for my father to return from a long journey... But Hien will not wait any longer, will he? Because you came for him. To take him back...because his nation is more important...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Um...I'm not sure how to answer this...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: A nation...is a place, I suppose. A place...and the people in it...and maybe the things, too...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But more than that, it's the history, the traditions, the words. The stories we tell ourselves and our children. Everything that came before and everything that comes after.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: The place we were born is part of who we are. We carry it with us, no matter where we go. Whoever...whatever we become, that part remains─that link to our fathers and their fathers before them...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: It's...it's not important to everyone, I suppose, and that's fine. But it's important to Hien. And to me.

dialogue.name: 02BOY02505
dialogue.text: ...Some call the Mol fools for listening to the elder gods, but it is our way. Our pride. Our...nation?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Something like that. It's something precious that you and others share─and that no one can ever take from you.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But we can talk more about it later! It's time to go home. Dorbei is waiting!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'll stay with the children. Why not go and let Cirina know how we got on?

dialogue.name: DORBEI
dialogue.text: You aided the children? That is well. I trust you enjoyed their company.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Did you speak with Dorbei?

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Well, well! Then you will forgive me if I ask you to wash your hands. I shall pour you a cup of milk tea in the meantime.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: The meal is almost ready, so we should summon Hien and Gosetsu...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: <yawn> That was just what I needed!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: A new beginning lies beyond the horizon. We have but to seize it with our own two hands.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Was the food to your liking? Good, good...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Well, my friends! I for one am full of vim and vigor! I trust you feel the same?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Then what better time than now to undertake our trial, and become full-fledged warriors of the Mol!

obj.n: Shop till the Warrior of Light Drops
